subject: Sales
title: Commitment and Consistency
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Commitment and Consistency.

hook.text: Ask someone to place a tiny sign in their yard. Weeks later, they'll agree to a huge billboard.

buildup.text: Once we commit to something small, we feel pressure to stay consistent with that decision.

discovery.text: Cialdini called it foot-in-the-door. Small yeses build a psychological path to the big yes.

twist.text: Cults use this masterfully. Each tiny commitment pulls people deeper without them noticing.

climax.text: In sales, ask for small commitments first: a meeting, a trial, a review. The big ask follows.

punchline.text: Small yeses pave the road to the big one.

quiz.question: What is the 'foot-in-the-door' technique?
options: Getting a small yes first to build to a larger one
Blocking the door during a pitch
